perturbation.original_text: 1.4 Supplier will receive Purchase Orders by telephone, USPS, overnight courier, email, and fax transmission, Monday through Friday except on state or nationally recognized bank holidays. Purchase Orders not received by 3:00 p.m. Eastern Time are considered to be received on the following Page 1 business day. Supplier will confirm or reject Purchase Orders within [***] of receipt of the Purchase Order. Orders not rejected in writing within such time will be deemed confirmed and accepted by Supplier.
perturbation.changed_text: 1.4 Supplier will receive Purchase Orders by telephone, USPS, overnight courier, email, and fax transmission, Monday through Friday except on state or nationally recognized bank holidays. Purchase Orders not received by 3:00 p.m. Eastern Time are considered to be received on the following business day two days later. Supplier will confirm or reject Purchase Orders within [***] of receipt of the Purchase Order. Orders not rejected verbally within such time will be deemed confirmed and accepted by Supplier.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a conflict by altering the time when purchase orders are considered 'received' and how rejections can occur. The original text considers orders received after 3:00 p.m. Eastern Time as received the following business day. The modified text changes this to two days later. Also, original text says that orders not rejected in writing will be deemed as confirmed but the modified one says that rejections can occur verbally. These creates uncertainty about when the supplier is obligated to fulfill the order and whether an oral confirmation is valid.

perturbation.original_text: 6.1 This Agreement will commence on the Effective Date and continue for an Initial Term of five (5) years, and will automatically renew for additional periods of five (5) years unless one Party notifies the other of its intention not to renew, no less than 12 months prior to the expiration of the then-current term, unless terminated as permitted under this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: 6.1 This Agreement will commence on the Effective Date and continue for an Initial Term of five (5) years, and will automatically renew for additional periods of one (1) year unless one Party notifies the other of its intention not to renew, no less than 6 months prior to the expiration of the then-current term, unless terminated as permitted under this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a conflict by altering the renewal period and notification period. The original text says that it will automatically renew for additional periods of five years, but the modified text says that the agreement will renew for additional periods of one year. Also, the original text states that a party has to notify the other of its intention not to renew no less than 12 months, whereas the modified text changes this to 6 months. These cause uncertainty about the actual duration of the contract and the deadline for providing non-renewal notice.

perturbation.original_text: 7.6 Supplier shall have Buyer named as an additional insured on its insurance policies in subparts 7.5.1 and 7.5.2 above. Supplier shall furnish Buyer with a certificate from its insurer verifying that it has the above insurance in effect during the duration of this Agreement and that insurer acknowledges (a) the contractual liability assumed by Supplier in this Agreement and (b) that Buyer is an additional insured on such policies and (c) Supplier's CGL policy is primary and Buyer's CGL policy is non-contributory and (d) a waiver of subrogation shall be provided in favor of Buyer on the CGL, Workers' Compensation and Auto policies. Said certificate of insurance shall require Supplier's insurance carrier to give Buyer no less than ten (10) days written notice of any cancellation or change in coverage.
perturbation.changed_text: 7.6 Supplier shall have Buyer named as an additional insured on its insurance policies in subparts 7.5.1 and 7.5.2 above. Supplier shall furnish Buyer with a certificate from its insurer verifying that it has the above insurance in effect during the duration of this Agreement and that insurer acknowledges (a) the contractual liability assumed by Supplier in this Agreement and (b) that Buyer is an additional insured on such policies and (c) Supplier's CGL policy is secondary and Buyer's CGL policy is contributory and (d) a waiver of subrogation shall not be provided in favor of Buyer on the CGL, Workers' Compensation and Auto policies. Said certificate of insurance shall require Supplier's insurance carrier to give Buyer no less than thirty (30) days written notice of any cancellation or change in coverage.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a conflict by altering the details of the insurance policy, specifically regarding CGL policy, contributory nature and waiver of subrogation. The original text says that the supplier's CGL policy is primary and buyer's CGL policy is non-contributory, but the modified text says the opposite, meaning that the supplier's CGL policy is secondary and buyer's CGL policy is contributory. Also, original text states that waiver of subrogation should be provided in favor of the buyer on the policies, whereas the modified text says that this should not be provided. These create uncertainty regarding which party's insurance bears primary responsibility and what the liability is. Finally, it changes the cancellation notice period from 10 to 30 days.
